text: This is a list of college softball coaches with 1,000 wins as a collegiate head coach. This list includes games won at the NCAA levels. It does not include games won at the junior college level. Coaches with 1,000 wins at the NCAA Division I level are designated with peach shading. ==All-time leaders== At the end of the 2019 season, Carol Hutchins of Michigan remained the all- time NCAA wins leader with 1,616 wins. Mike Candrea has the most NCAA Division I national championships with eight (1991, 1993, 1994, 1996, 1997, 2001, 2006, and 2007). His .794 winning percentage is also the highest among active Division I coaches. Melinda Fischer of Illinois State holds the record for most losses as a head softball coach with 818. ==College softball coaches with 1,000 wins== ===Key=== {| class="wikitable" |- |* |Active coach in 2019 |- |† |Inducted into the National Fastpitch Coaches Association Hall of Fame |- | bgcolor=#FFE5B4| | bgcolor=#FFE5B4|1,000 wins with an NCAA Division I program (or historic equivalent) |} ===Coaches=== :Unless otherwise noted, statistics are correct thru February 1, 2020. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text- align:center" |- !Rank !width=110|Name !Years !Wins !Losses !Ties !Pct !Teams |- |1 * || bgcolor=#FFE5B4|Carol Hutchins † || 36 || 1616 || 517 || 5 || || Ferris State (1982), Michigan (1985–present) |- |2 * || bgcolor=#FFE5B4|Mike Candrea † || 32 || 1611 || 418 || 2 || || Arizona (1986–present) |- |3 || bgcolor=#FFE5B4|Margie Wright † || 33 || 1457 || 542 || 3 || || Illinois State (1980–1985), Fresno State (1986–2012) |- |4 * || bgcolor=#FFE5B4|Ralph Weekly † || 32 || 1394 || 457 || 2 || || Pacific Lutheran (1986–1994), Chattanooga (1995–1998, 2001), Tennessee (2002–present) |- |5 * || bgcolor=#FFE5B4|Diane Ninemire † || 32 || 1345 || 678 || 0 || || California (1988–present) |- |6 || bgcolor=#FFE5B4|Eugene Lenti † || 36 || 1300 || 656 || 6 || || DePaul (1980–1987, 1990–2018) |- |7 * || Gary Bryce † || 38 || 1307 || 767 || 8 || || Wayne State (1982–present) |- |8 * || bgcolor=#FFE5B4|Donna Papa † || 36 || 1295 || 724 || 5 || || Susquehanna (1984–1985), North Carolina (1986–present) |- |9 || bgcolor=#FFE5B4|Yvette Girouard † || 31 || 1285 || 421 || 1 || || Louisiana–Lafayette (1981–2000), LSU (2001–2011) |- |10 * || bgcolor=#FFE5B4|Margo F.
